frameDefinitions: This frame has to do with the bias or lack of bias of a Judge making an assessment concerning two or more Sides.
An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.
In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.
A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of  Possibilities .
In this frame, an Entity or Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question.
A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
frameExamples: She <t>scattered</t> his ashes in the bay.
Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
The council <t>picked</t> you out of all the pilots available to head this mission.
We found some <t>suspicious</t> checks lying on his desk.
Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
listRoleDefinitions: This Frame Element marks the person whose objectivity in making assesment is being evaluated.
This Frame Element marks one of the <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or one of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks phrases jointly expressing both <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or all of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
The second-mentioned of the <fen>Sides</fen> to a dispute or alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate how the bias of the <fen>Judge</fen> expresses itself in their behavior or actions.
The <fen>Dispute</fen> is the situation in which there is some conflict between two sides.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Decision_maker</fen>.
This role denotes the time when the partiality occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> disperses or scatters the <fen>Individuals</fen>.
The <fen>Individuals</fen> are scattered by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An event or force that causes that <fen>Individuals</fen> to disperse.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are dispersed.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the dispersing event happens.
The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen> out of the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.
<fen>Chosen</fen> identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.

A <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes a choice from among a set of <fen>Possibilities</fen>. <fen>Possibilities</fen> are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by 'whether or 'if'.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the choosing occurs.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the state of affairs or action of the social actor that is regarded as susipcious.
An individual that is suspected of wrongdoing because of the <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> metonymically stands in for a <fen>Behavior</fen> that saliently involves the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The referee</fex> was totally biased against our team.
The umpire was partial <fex>to the home team</fex>.
The judge was neutral <fex>between the parties</fex>.
The judge favored the defendant <fex>over the plaintiff</fex>.
My sister remained neutral <fex>in our disputes</fex>.
He had a neutral <fex>smile</fex> on his face.
<fex>We</fex>have to pick a colour for the living room.
I decided <fex>to give it another try</fex>.
They chose their new guitarist <fex>out of more than 300 auditioners</fex>.
I was n't chosen <fex>in the last round</fex>.
The winner was selected <fex>in the secret meeting room</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) Governing Board
